image.altText: Hand holding money, notes and coins with a coffee cup and fruit in the background, cost of living

props.synopsis: Two federal ombudsmen have joined forces to launch a scathing review of the Australian Tax Office and call on government agencies to act more fairly when they chase people for debts.

title.children: 'It's disappointing this occurred': ATO told off for resurrecting old tax debts

image.altText: A young man in in a wheelchair, wearing a floral shirt.

props.synopsis: The teenager took part in a three-year Queensland Health pilot study using whole genome sequencing of children with rare conditions.

title.children: After 16 years, Dominic's family finally know what to call the rare condition he's been living with since birth

image.altText: People stand on the far side of a river bank, looking cold on a grey day as the brown water cuts off a road.

props.synopsis: The southern states could be in for a wet Easter weekend as record-breaking rains inundating central Australia are expected to move south.

title.children: Record outback rains could move south this Easter

image.altText: Two  women walk past the Reserve Bank of Australia headquarters, with the building's name prominent in the background.

props.synopsis: Despite the brutal round of interest rate hikes, people are still holding onto their jobs — and the unpredictable nature of the real world is making a mockery of economics textbooks. Is it a miracle, or have we arrived at a point where unemployment and inflation can subside together?

title.children: Deal with the devil: Why central banks want you out of work

image.altText: A close-up shot of Donald Trump's face, with an annoyed expression.

props.synopsis: A New York court extends a deadline and slashes the amount of money Donald Trump must pay as bond to avoid having his assets seized, as another court orders a separate criminal trial to go ahead next month.

title.children: Donald Trump has a win and a loss as New York courts rule in separate cases

image.altText: A ferocious-looking crocodile inside a cage.

props.synopsis: A Queensland man says the saltie "had a go" at him while he was mowing the lawn and ate three of his neighbour's chickens. After months "on edge", residents were relieved to see the big predator captured.

title.children: 3.9m stalker croc caught after terrorising river residents for months

image.altText: A drone hovers while a green laser appears pointed at it.

props.synopsis: Defence has for the first time awarded a multi-million-dollar contract to a Melbourne company to trial its "directed energy" technology as a way of combating unmanned aerial vehicles.

title.children: Defence to trial drone-killing lasers that use advanced 'directed energy' technology

image.altText: A man in a suit next to a construction site

props.synopsis: The chairman of Hutchinson Builders says the boom in demand is paradoxically causing builders and subcontractors to go bust,

title.children: 'It's counterintuitive': Why Australia's construction boom is sending builders broke

image.altText: Victor sits on a bench with his young son King George, both smling in front of a colourful painted mural.

props.synopsis: When Manisha Gazula started teaching at one of Australia's most disadvantaged schools, nine in 10 students were moving on to high school with sub-par reading skills. Now the students are outperforming the "good schools" and "punching above their weight".

title.children: Students at one of Australia's most disadvantaged schools now outperforming the 'good schools'

image.altText: People sit behind a desk with their hand raised in a vote

props.synopsis: The UN Security Council demands an immediate ceasefire between Israel and Palestinian militants Hamas and the immediate and unconditional release of all hostages after the US abstained from the vote.

title.children: UN Security Council calls for ceasefire in Gaza during Ramadan — its first demand to halt fighting

image.altText: A tiny baby lying on a hosptal bed. Blue gloved hands hold an oxygen mask to their face.

props.synopsis: RSV is a highly contagious virus that attacks the lungs and can lead to respiratory illnesses including bronchiolitis and pneumonia. It is the leading cause of hospitalisation for infants in the state.

title.children: This virus lands more babies and young children in hospital than any other condition, and now there's a free jab

image.altText: A long exposure creates a blurry and distorted image of Tamara Oudyn sitting at the ABC News desk in the studio.

props.synopsis: An estimated 4.9 million Australians battle through the debilitating pain of migraines. But despite estimates the condition costs the national economy billions each year, a leading researcher says there's far from enough funding or support.

title.children: If I'm getting a migraine while reading the news, my face is a dead giveaway

image.altText: A family stand and smile for a photo

props.synopsis: Daniel Stuart's family was still clinging to hope he was alive after receiving a dreaded call from police, until they saw online footage of his truck engulfed in flames.

title.children: 'Blow on top of blow' for family of truck driver killed in triple-fatal crash at Maryborough

image.altText: a suspect in the shooting attack at the Crocus City Hall

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin says last week's deadly attack on a concert hall near Moscow was conducted by Islamist militants but the shooting fits with a wider campaign of intimidation by Ukraine.

title.children: Putin suggests Ukraine linked to deadly Moscow concert hall attack

image.altText: A phone screen displaying the WhatsApp app

props.synopsis: Russian officials summon a top Australian diplomat in Moscow for a please explain over a social media post describing the country's presidential election as a "flagrant violation of international law".

title.children: Furious Russians summon Australian diplomat over social media post criticising election

image.altText: Green wavy hills with mountains and sky in the background

props.synopsis: Our ancestors left Africa some 70,000 years ago, but it took them thousands of years to make it to Europe or Asia. A DNA study may shed light on where they ended up during this 'long pause'.

title.children: 'A very big question in human evolution': Where did our ancestors go after leaving Africa?

image.altText: A man walks up cement steps past a map on a wall

props.synopsis: Evergrande's founder is barred for life from China's financial markets after the company allegedly falsified its revenue — here's what we know so far.

title.children: Chinese property developer Evergrande faces a $120 billion fraud accusation. Here's what we know

image.altText: photo of building with blue sky background

props.synopsis: Two girls, aged 13 and 14 at the time of their arrest, faced court for sentencing today after pleading guilty to charges including torture, deprivation of liberty, and attempting to pervert justice.

title.children: Teen girl 'feels really bad' for torturing 13-year-old in incident that went viral on TikTok

image.altText: Nina crouches beside a brown dog

props.synopsis: Like the Princess of Wales, mum-of-three Nina Di Santo was not in the age group of concern for cancer, her diagnosis is classified as "early onset" and experts say there is an increase in younger people impacted by the disease.

title.children: Nina was diagnosed with bowel cancer in her 30s, experts say she's not alone

image.altText: A close up looking over the shoulder of a woman using her mobile phone on the platform of the train station.

props.synopsis: Noticed less political content in your Instagram feed lately? It's a deliberate move by the social media giant to stop "proactively" recommending political content posted on accounts users don't follow — but experts say the move could impact democracy.

title.children: Instagram is limiting the amount of political content in your feed – experts say it's a threat to democracy

image.altText: A shirtless black man sits in a barrel at night while two south-east Asian men stand aggressively over him.

props.synopsis: A series of videos described as "barbaric" have circulated online, showing what appear to be soldiers punching, kicking and slicing a Papuan man in a barrel.

title.children: Top general apologises for 'barbaric' torture video as 13 soldiers detained amid ongoing probe

image.altText: IMAGE MAIN 25 Mar

props.synopsis: The NSW housing minister says she's asked the federal government to double its multi-billion-dollar spend in housing to accelerate home construction.

title.children: NSW demands federal government doubles funding for housing

image.altText: A tall, gold-tinged building towers over a vintage-style clock on a public street in New York.

props.synopsis: Mr Trump is facing an imminent deadline to post a bond of $US454 million as he looks to appeal a ruling he fraudulently overstated the value of his assets — or New York's attorney-general could begin confiscating his properties.

title.children: How wealthy is Donald Trump exactly? Here's a look at his companies, properties and income

image.altText: The Apple tech company logo of an apple is illuminated in white against a black background

props.synopsis: The first such cases in Europe focus on the way each company is operating, amid allegations the companies are deliberately crushing competition.

title.children: The world's biggest tech companies are under investigation for cornering digital markets in Europe

image.altText: Early risers walk along the Whyalla foreshore.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has big plans for Whyalla with a $593 million hydrogen plant in the works. But there is mixed excitement and concern about the pressure on an already difficult housing market.

title.children: New dawn promised for steel city, with hydrogen tipped to deliver population boom — but where will everyone live?

image.altText: The shell of a house.

props.synopsis: In the northern New South Wales town of Moree, kids are recording their at times violent crimes for social media. Locals hope compassion and understanding will help those children change their ways.

title.children: 'They can't be blamed for everything': The sad reality and vision for hope behind Moree's crime problem

image.altText: A man sitting in a wheelchair next to his service dog on an airport tarmac

props.synopsis: An Adelaide disability advocate says he felt "embarrassed" and "shocked" during a trip to the Gold Coast with Virgin Australia.

title.children: 'The cabin manager rolled their eyes': Virgin Australia apologises to disability advocate

image.altText: Composite of a man in black and white with a shipping yard photo behind him.

props.synopsis: The Melbourne-based chapter of the 'Ndrangheta may be using "fake news" to try and divert law enforcement away from its leadership, an Italian organised crime expert has said.

title.children: The Calabrian mafia may be using 'fake news' but the killing of a Melbourne man is likely a message sent

image.altText: A drone photo of a boat in the water with thousands of silver fish thrashing around it.

props.synopsis: Thousands of salmon were spotted surfacing and feeding near Cape Jaffa, South Australia, with one keen fisher capturing a video of the scene from above.

title.children: 'It happened in a matter of seconds': Spectacular salmon feeding frenzy captured on fisher's drone footage

image.altText: A man waving a finger in the air wearing two coats and a button up shirt.

props.synopsis: The company has been under serious pressure following several mishaps including a mid-air panel blowout on one of its planes in January.

title.children: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun to step down following series of safety mishaps from aircraft giant

image.altText: A man in a blue shift and sunglasses

props.synopsis: Matej Radelic, 45, faced the Broome Magistrates Court on multiple counts of assault over the high-profile incident in the tourist town earlier this month.

title.children: Man accused of cable-tying children's hands faces court in Broome

image.altText: Quake 1

props.synopsis: The magnitude-6.9 earthquake has shaken villages along the Sepik River that which were already battling a flood disaster.

title.children: PNG earthquake destroys 1,000 homes and reportedly kills three people

image.altText: Five women are pictured wearing orange polo's with the Dutch flag on them.

props.synopsis: Two players quit the Dutch women's darts team, saying they refuse to team up with trans woman Noa-Lynn van Leuven, who is backed by the sport's governing body.

title.children: Dutch darts players quit national women's team over transgender teammate
